page.title: 19LOCAL CUSTOMS
page.content:
Although today life here is much the same as elsewhere in the country,some of the old customs and superstitions still remain.
One such custom is St.Magdalena's Fair.In 1321 Edward II granted the right to hold a weekly market at Geoffrey Scrope's manor of Constable Burton and a yearly fair on the feast of St.Mary Magdalene (22nd July).
For the past few years the villagers have held a modern "fair" with stalls,sideshows and many games.The school children perform country dances.An ancient custom revived.
A superstition which still exists is that surrounding the murder stone reputed to be on the site where a murder took place.
